onboarding.subject: Urban Gardening for Small Spaces
onboarding.why: To grow fresh vegetables and herbs on my apartment balcony
onboarding.summary: Wants to learn how to start a productive garden in a small apartment balcony space.

profiling.focus_areas: container gardening, vertical planters, herbs, easy vegetables
profiling.notes: Learner lives in an apartment with a small balcony.

course_structure.title: Balcony to Bounty: Urban Gardening Masterclass

phases.title: Assessing Your Space & Conditions
phases.description: Evaluate your balcony's light, wind, and space to choose the right plants.

lessons.title: Mapping Sunlight and Microclimates
lessons.description: How to track sun exposure on your balcony to know what can actually grow there.
lessons.instructional_seed: Teach the learner how to map sunlight hours on their balcony. Explain direct vs indirect light and how buildings create microclimates. The goal is to prevent them from buying sun-loving plants for a shady corner.

lessons.title: Container Logistics: Pots, Soil, and Drainage
lessons.description: Choosing the right containers and soil mix for a concrete environment.
lessons.instructional_seed: Explain why garden soil kills pot plants (compaction). Teach the recipe for a good potting mix. Discuss pot materials (plastic vs terracotta) in relation to wind and water retention.

phases.title: The Starter Kitchen Garden
phases.description: Planting your first high-success crops: herbs and leafy greens.

lessons.title: Herb Spirals and Vertical Planters
lessons.description: Maximizing vertical space to grow basil, mint, and parsley.
lessons.instructional_seed: Focus on verticality. Show how to use wall-mounted pockets or tiered stands. Teach the specific needs of woody herbs (rosemary) vs soft herbs (basil).

lessons.title: Cut-and-Come-Again Greens
lessons.description: Growing lettuce, spinach, and arugula for continuous harvesting.
lessons.instructional_seed: Teach the technique of harvesting outer leaves so the plant keeps growing. Explain succession planting so they never run out of salad.

phases.title: Fruiting Vegetables in Pots
phases.description: Moving up to tomatoes, peppers, and beans in a container environment.

lessons.title: Tomatoes in Small Spaces
lessons.description: Selecting determinate varieties and managing support structures.
lessons.instructional_seed: Explain the difference between determinate (bush) and indeterminate (vine) tomatoes. Teach pruning suckers to keep plants manageable in a small space.

lessons.title: Pollination Partnering
lessons.description: How to ensure fruit set when you don't have many bees around.
lessons.instructional_seed: Urban balconies often lack pollinators. Teach hand-pollination techniques for peppers and tomatoes using a paintbrush or gentle shaking.

phases.title: Maintenance and Troubleshooting
phases.description: Keeping your garden alive through heatwaves, pests, and vacations.

lessons.title: Watering Systems for Busy People
lessons.description: Setting up self-watering pots or simple drip irrigation.
lessons.instructional_seed: Pots dry out fast. Teach how to make a DIY self-watering reservoir or use olla pots. Discuss mulching to retain moisture.

lessons.title: Organic Pest Control
lessons.description: Dealing with aphids and mites without spraying toxic chemicals.
lessons.instructional_seed: Teach identification of common urban pests like spider mites. Explain neem oil and soapy water sprays as safe treatments for food plants.
